## Checklist

<!-- Mark completed items with an 'x' -->

### Code Quality

- [ ] My code follows the project's style guidelines (Black formatted)
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings
- [ ] I have removed any debug/console statements

### Testing

- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [ ] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes
- [ ] Test coverage is maintained or improved (>80%)
- [ ] I have tested edge cases and error conditions

### Type Safety & Security

- [ ] I have added type hints to new functions and methods
- [ ] mypy passes with no errors
- [ ] bandit security scan passes with no new issues
- [ ] I have not introduced security vulnerabilities

### Documentation

- [ ] I have updated the documentation accordingly
- [ ] I have updated docstrings for new/modified functions
- [ ] I have added/updated examples if needed
- [ ] I have updated CHANGELOG.md (for significant changes)

### Commits & Git

- [ ] My commits are well-organized and have descriptive messages
- [ ] I have rebased/merged latest main branch
- [ ] There are no merge conflicts
- [ ] Pre-commit hooks pass

### Dependencies

- [ ] I have not added new dependencies (or have justified them below)
- [ ] If dependencies added, I have run security scan on them
- [ ] requirements.txt / pyproject.toml is updated

### Backward Compatibility

- [ ] This change is backward compatible
- [ ] If not backward compatible, I have documented breaking changes above
- [ ] Migration guide provided for breaking changes
